sp.p: Did n't you understand that you are a queen , and I a fool who is in love with his queen ? Do n't you know , Consuelo , that every queen has a fool , and he is always in love with her , and they always beat him for it . HE Who Gets Slapped .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No . I did n't know .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , every queen . Beauty has her fool . Wisdom , too . Oh , how many fools she has ! Her court is overcrowded with enamoured fools , and the sound of slaps does not cease , even through the night . But I never received such a sweet slap as the one given by my little queen .Someone appears at the door . HE notices it , and continues to play , making many faces .Clown HE can have no rival ! Who is there who could stand such a deluge of slaps , such a hail-storm of slaps , and not get soaked ?Feigns to cry aloud .“ Have pity on me . I am but a poor fool ! ”

div.stage: Enter two men : an actor , dressed as a bareback rider , and a gentleman from the audience . He is spare , dressed in black , very respectable . He carries his hat in his hand .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Laughing , embarrassedHE , there is someone here . Stop !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Gets upWho is it ? Who dares to intrude in the castle of my queen ?

div.stage: HE stops , suddenly . Consuelo , laughing , jumps up and runs away , after a quick glance at the gentleman .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: You cheered me up , HE . Good-bye .At the doorYou shall get a note to-morrow .

sp.speaker: THE BAREBACK RIDER
sp.p: LaughingA jolly fellow , sir . You wanted to see him ? There he is . HE , the gentleman wants to see you .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: In a depressed voiceWhat can I do for you ?

div.stage: The actor bows , and goes away , smiling . Both men take a step toward each other .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Is this you ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes ! It is I . And you ?Silence .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Must I believe my eyes ? Is this you , Mr .——

lg.l: : My name here is HE . I have no other name , do you hear ? HE
Who Gets Slapped . And if you want to stay here , do n't forget it .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: You are so familiar . As far as I can remember ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: We are all familiar , here .ContemptuouslyBesides , that 's all you deserve , anywhere .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: HumblyYou have not forgiven me , HE ?Silence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Are you here with my wife ? Is she , too , in the circus ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: QuicklyOh , no ! I am alone . She stayed there !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You 've left her already ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: HumblyNo — we have — a son . After your sudden and mysterious disappearance — when you left that strange and insulting letter ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: LaughsInsulting ? You are still able to feel insults ? What are you doing here ? Were you looking for me , or is it an accident ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I have been looking for you , for half a year — through many countries . And suddenly , to-day — by accident , indeed — I had no acquaintances here , and I went to the circus . We must talk things over ... HE , I implore you .Silence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Here is a shadow I cannot lose ! To talk things over ! Do you really think we still have something to talk over ? All right . Leave your address with the porter , and I will let you know when you can see me . Now get out .Proudly .I am busy .

div.stage: The gentleman bows and leaves . HE does not return his bow , but stands with outstretched hand , in the pose of a great man , who shows a boring visitor the door .
CURTAIN

div.head: ACT III

stage.stage: The same room . Morning , before the rehearsal . HE is striding thoughtfully up and down the room . He wears a broad , parti-coloured coat , and a prismatic tie . His derby is on the back of his head , and his face is clean-shaven like that of an actor . His eyebrows are drawn , lips pressed together energetically , his whole appearance severe and sombre . After the entrance of the gentleman he changes . His face becomes clown-like , mobile — a living mask .

The gentleman comes in . He is dressed in black , and has an extremely well-bred appearance . His thin face is yellowish , like an invalid 's . When he is upset , his colourless , dull eyes often twitch . HE does not notice him .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Good morning , sir .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Turning around and looking at him absent-mindedlyAh ! It 's you .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I am not late ? You look as if you did not expect me . I hope I am not disturbing you ? You fixed this time yourself however , and I took the liberty ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: No manners , please . What do you want ? Tell me quickly , I have no time .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Looking around with distasteI expected you would invite me to some other place ... to your home .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I have no other home . This is my home .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: But people may disturb us here .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: So much the worse for you . Talk faster !Silence .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Will you allow me to sit down ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Sit down . Look out ! That chair is broken .

div.stage: The gentleman , afraid , pushes away the chair and looks helplessly around . Everything here seems to him dangerous and strange . He chooses an apparently solid little gilded divan , and sits down ; puts his silk hat aside , slowly takes off his gloves , which stick to his fingers . HE observes him indifferently .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: In this suit , and with this face , you make a still stranger impression . Yesterday it seemed to me that it was all a dream ; to-day ... you ...

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You have forgotten my name again ? My name is HE .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: You are determined to continue talking to me like this ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Decidedly ! But you are squandering your time like a millionaire . Hurry up !

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I really do n't know .... Everything here strikes me so .... These posters , horses , animals , which I passed when I was looking for you .... And finally , you , a clown in a circus !With a slight , deprecating smile .Could I expect it ? It is true , when everybody there decided that you were dead , I was the only man who did not agree with them . I felt that you were still alive . But to find you among such surroundings — I can n't understand it .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You said you have a son , now . Does n't he look like me ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I do n't understand ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Do n't you know that widows or divorced women often have children by the new husband , which resemble the old one ? This misfortune did not befall you ?Laughs .And your book , too , is a big success , I hear .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: You want to insult me again ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: LaughingWhat a restless , touchy faker you are ! Please sit still ; be quiet . It is the custom here to speak this way . Why were you trying to find me ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: My conscience ....

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You have no conscience . Or were you afraid that you had n't robbed me of everything I possessed , and you came for the rest ? But what more could you take from me now ? My fool 's cap with its bells ? You would n't take it . It 's too big for your bald head ! Crawl back , you book-worm !

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: You cannot forgive the fact that your wife ....

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: To the devil with my wife !The gentleman is startled and raises his eyebrows . HE laughs .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I do n't know .... But such language ! I confess I find difficulty in expressing my thoughts in such an atmosphere , but if you are so ... indifferent to your wife , who , I shall allow myself to emphasize the fact , loved you and thought you were a saint ——HE laughs .Then what brought you to such a ... step ? Or is it that you cannot forgive me my success ? A success , it is true , not entirely deserved . And now you want to take vengeance , with your humbleness , on those who misunderstood you . But you always were so indifferent to glory . Or your indifference was only hypocrisy . And when I , a more lucky rival ...

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: With a burst of laughterRival ! You — a rival !

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Growing PaleBut my book !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You are talking to me about your book ? To me ?The gentleman is very pale . HE looks at him with curiosity and mockery .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Raising his eyesI am a very unhappy man .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I am a very unhappy man . You must forgive me . I am deeply , irreparably , and infinitely unhappy .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: But why ? Explain it to me .Starts walking up and down .You say yourself that your book is a tremendous success , you are famous , you have glory ; there is not a yellow newspaper in which you and your thoughts are not mentioned . Who knows me ? Who cares about my heavy abstractions , from which it was difficult for them to derive a single thought ? You — you are the great vulgarizer ! You have made my thoughts comprehensible even to horses ! With the art of a great vulgarizer , a tailor of ideas , you dressed my Apollo in a barber 's jacket , you handed my Venus a yellow ticket , and to my bright hero you gave the ears of an ass . And then your career is made , as Jackson says . And wherever I go , the whole street looks at me with thousands of faces , in which — what mockery — I recognize the traits of my own children . Oh ! How ugly your son must be , if he resembles me ! Why then are you unhappy , you poor devil ?The gentleman bows his head , plucking at his gloves .The police have n't caught you , as yet . What am I talking about ? Is it possible to catch you ? You always keep within the limits of the law . You have been torturing yourself up to now because you are not married to my wife . A notary public is always present at your thefts . What is the use of this self-torture , my friend ? Get married . I died . You are not satisfied with having taken only my wife ? Let my glory remain in your possession . It is yours . Accept my ideas . Assume all the rights , my most lawful heir ! I died ! And when I was dyingmaking a stupidly pious faceI forgave thee !Bursts out laughing . The gentleman raises his head , and bending forward , looks straight into HE 's eyes .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: And my pride ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Have you any pride ?The gentleman straightens up , and nods his head silently .Yes ! But please stand off a little . I do n't like to look at you . Think of it . There was a time when I loved you a little , even thought you a little gifted ! You — my empty shadow .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Nodding his headI am your shadow .HE keeps on walking , and looks over his shoulder at the gentleman , with a smile .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Oh , you are marvellous ! What a comedy ! What a touching comedy ! Listen . Tell me frankly if you can ; do you hate me very much ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Yes ! With all the hate there is in the world ! Sit down here .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You order me ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Sit down here . Thank you .Bows .I am respected and I am famous , yes ? I have a wife and a son , yes .Laughs slowly .My wife still loves you : our favourite discussion is about your genius . She supposes you are a genius . We , I and she , love you even when we are in bed . Tss ! It is I who must make faces . My son — yes , he 'll resemble you . And when , in order to have a little rest , I go to my desk , to my ink-pot , my books — there , too , I find you . Always you ! Everywhere you ! And I am never alone — never myself and alone . And when at night — you , sir , should understand this — when at night I go to my lonely thoughts , to my sleepless contemplations , even then I find your image in my head , in my unfortunate brain , your damned and hateful image !Silence . The gentleman 's eyes twitch .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Speaking slowlyWhat a comedy . How marvellously everything is turned about in this world : the robbed proves to be a robber , and the robber is complaining of theft , and cursing !Laughs .Listen , I was mistaken . You are not my shadow . You are the crowd . If you live by my creations , you hate me ; if you breathe my breath , you are choking with anger . And choking with anger , hating me , you still walk slowly on the trail of my ideas . But you are advancing backward , advancing backward , comrade ! Oh , what a marvellous comedy !Walking and smiling .Tell me , would you be relieved if I really had died ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Yes ! I think so . Death augments distance and dulls the memory . Death reconciles . But you do not look like a man who ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , yes ! Death , certainly !

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Sit down here .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Your obedient servant . Yes ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Certainly , I do not dare to ask you —makes a grimaceto ask you to die , but tell me : you 'll never come back there ? No , do n't laugh . If you want me to , I 'll kiss your hand . Do n't grimace ! I would have done so if you had died .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: SlowlyGet out , vermin !

div.stage: Enter Tilly and Polly as in the first act , playing . For a long time they do not see the two men .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Jack !

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: Ah ! Good morning , HE . We are rehearsing . You know it is very hard . Jack has just about as much music in his head as my pig .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Introducing , nonchalantlyMy friend .... For the benefit performance ?The clowns bow to the gentleman , making idiotic faces .

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: Yes . What are you preparing ? You are cunning , HE ! Consuelo told me what you are preparing for the benefit performance . She leaves us soon , you know ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Is that so ?

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: Zinida told us . Do you think she would get a benefit performance otherwise ? She is a nice girl .

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: Taking his small flute-pipeHere ! Do n't walk as if you were an elephant . Do n't forget you are an ant ! Come on !They go off , playing .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: SmilingThese are your new comrades ? How strange they are !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Everything here is strange .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: This suit of yours . Black used to be very becoming to you . This one hurts the eyes .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Looking himself overWhy ? It looks very nice . The rehearsal has begun . You must go away . You are disturbing us .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: You did not answer my question .

div.stage: Slow strains of the Tango from a small orchestra in the ring .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Listening absent-mindedly to the musicWhat question ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Who does not hear the musicI pray you to tell me : will you ever come back ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Listening to the musicNever , never , never !

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Getting upThank you . I am going .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Never , never , never ! Yes , run along . And do n't come back . There you were still bearable and useful for something , but here you are superfluous .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: But if something should happen to you ... you are a healthy man , but in this environment , these people ... how will I know ? They do n't know your name here ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: My name here is unknown , but you will know . Anything else ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I can be at peace ? On your word of honour ? Of course I mean , comparatively , at peace ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , you may be comparatively at peace . Never !They walk to the door , the gentleman stops .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: May I come to the circus ? You will allow me ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Certainly . You are the audience !Laughs .But I sha n't give you my card for a pass . But why do you want to come ? Or do you like the circus so much , and since when ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: I want to look at you some more , and to understand , perhaps . Such a transformation ! Knowing you as I do , I cannot admit that you are here without any idea . But what idea ?Looks short-sightedly at HE . HE grimaces and thumbs his nose .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: What is that ?

lg.l: My idea ! Good-bye , Prince ! My regards to your respected wife , your
Highness ’ wonderful son !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: You positively live in the circus , HE . Whenever I come , you are here . You are a fanatic in your work , sir .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: IntroducingPrince Poniatovsky , Count Mancini .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Drawing himself upVery , very glad . And you too , Prince , you know my queer fellow ? What a nice face he has , has n't he ?He touches HE 'S shoulder patronizingly , with the tip of his cane .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: AwkwardlyYes , I have the pleasure ... certainly . Good-bye , Count .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Good-day , Prince .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Accompanying himLook out , your Highness , for the dark passages : the steps are so rotten . Unfortunately I cannot usher you out to the street .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: In a low voiceYou will not give me your hand when we say good-bye ? We are parting for ever .

lg.l: Unnecessary , Prince . I shall still hope to meet you in the Kingdom of
Heaven . I trust you will be there , too ?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: With disgustHow you did succeed ! You have so much of the clown in you !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I am HE Who is Getting Slapped . Good-bye , Prince .They take another step .

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.p: Looking HE in the eyes ; in a very low voiceTell me , you are not mad ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Just at low , his eyes wide openI am afraid , I am afraid you are right , Prince .Still lowAss ! Never in your life did you use such a precise expression . I am mad !

div.stage: Playing the clown again , he shows him to the stair , with a big , affected gesture , a sweep of the hand and arm from his head to the floor , the fingers moving , to represent the steps .

lg.l: He is down ! Au revoir , Prince .
lg.stage: The gentleman goes out . HE comes skipping back , and takes a pose .
lg.l: Mancini ! Let us dance the
Tango ! Mancini , I adore you !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Sitting back comfortably and playing with his caneDo n't forget yourself , HE . But you 're hiding something , my boy . I always said you used to belong to society . It is so easy to talk to you . And who is this Prince ? A genuine one ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Genuine . A first-rater . Like you !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: A sympathetic face . Although at first I thought he was an undertaker who came for an order . Ah , HE ! When shall I finally depart from these dirty walls , from Papa Briquet , stupid posters , and brutal jockeys !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Very soon , Mancini .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , soon . I am simply exhausted in these surroundings , HE ! I begin to feel myself a horse . You are from society , still you do n't yet know what high society means . To be at last decently dressed , to attend receptions , to display the splendour of wit ; from time to time to have a game of baccaratlaughingwithout tricks or cheating ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: And when evening comes , go to a suburb , where you are considered an honest father , who loves his children and ——

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: And get hold of something , eh ?Laughs .I shall wear a silk mask and two butlers shall follow me , thus protecting me from the dirty crowd . Ah , HE ! The blood of my ancestors boils in me . Look at this stiletto . What do you think ? Do you think that it was ever stained with blood ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You frighten me , Count !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Laughing , and putting the stiletto back into its sheathFool !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: And what about the girl ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Tss ! I give those bourgeois absolute satisfaction , and they glorify my name .Laughs .The splendour of my name is beginning to shine with a force unknown . By the way , do you know what automobile firms are the best ? Money is no object .Laughs .Ah ! Papa Briquet !

div.stage: Enter Briquet in his overcoat and silk hat . They shake hands .

lg.l: So , Mancini , you have obtained a benefit performance for your daughter ,
Consuelo ! I only want to tell you , that if it were not for Zinida ....

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Listen , Briquet . Decidedly you are a donkey . What are you complaining of ? The Baron has bought all the parquet seats for Consuelo 's benefit performance . Is n't that enough for you , you miser ?

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: I love your daughter , Mancini , and I am sorry to let her go . What more does she need here ? She has an honest job , wonderful comrades , and the atmosphere —?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Not she , but I need something . You understand ?Laughs .I asked you to increase her salary , Harpagon ! and now , Mr . Manager , would n't you like to change me a thousand franc note ?

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: With a sighGive it to me .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: NonchalantlyTo-morrow . I left it at home .All three laugh .Laugh , laugh ! To-day we are going with the Baron to his villa in the country ; people say a very nice villa .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: What for ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: You know , HE , the crazes of these billionaires . He wants to show Consuelo some winter roses , and me his wine cellars . He will come for us here . What is the matter , my little Consuelo ?

div.stage: Enter CONSUELO , almost crying .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I can n't father ! Tell him ! What right has he to yell at me ? He almost hit me with his whip !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Straightening upBriquet ! I beg of you , as the Manager , what is this — a stable ? To hit my daughter with a whip ! I 'll show this cub ... a mere jockey .... No , the devil knows what it is , devil knows , I swear ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Father ....

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: I will tell him .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Please do n't . Alfred did n't hit me . It 's a silly thing , what I told you . What an idea ! He is so sorry himself ....

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: I shall tell him anyhow that ——

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Do n't you dare . You must n't tell him anything . He did n't do a thing .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Still excitedHe must beg her pardon , the brat .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: He 's already asked me to forgive him . How silly you all are ! I simply cannot work to-day and I got nervous . What nonsense ! The silly boy asked me to forgive him , but I did n't want to . HE , dear , good morning ! I did n't notice you . How becoming your tie is ! Where are you going , Briquet ? To Alfred ?

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: No , I am going home , dear child . Zinida asked me to give you her love . She will not be here to-day , either .He goes out .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Zinida is so nice , so good . Father , why is it that everybody seems so nice to me ? Probably because I am going away soon . HE , did you hear the march that Tilly and Polly will play ?Laughs .Such a cheerful one .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes . I heard it . Your benefit performance will be remarkable .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I think so , too . Father I am hungry . Have them bring me a sandwich .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I 'll run for it , my Queen .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Please do , HE .LoudlyBut not cheese . I do n't like it .

div.stage: MANCINI and CONSUELO are alone . MANCINI , lying back comfortably in an armchair , scrutinizes his daughter with a searching eye .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: I find something particular in you to-day , my child . I do n't know whether it is something better or worse . You cried ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Yes , a little . Oh , I am so hungry .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: But you had your breakfast ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , I did n't . That 's why I am so hungry . You again forgot to leave me some money this morning , and without money ....

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Oh , the devil ... what a memory I have .Laughs .But we shall have a very nice meal to-day . Do n't eat very many sandwiches .... Yes , positively I like you . You must cry more often , my child ; it washes off your superfluous simplicity . You become more of a woman .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Am I so simple , Father ?

lg.l: Very .... Too much . I like it in others , but not in you . Besides , the
Baron ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Nonsense . I am not simple . But you know , Bezano scolded me so much , that even you would have cried . The devil knows ....

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Tsss .... Never say “ the devil knows . ” It is n't decent .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I say it only when I am with you .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: You must not say it when you are with me , either . I know it without you .Laughs .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Ha ! Listen , Father ! It 's a new number of Alfred 's . He makes such a jump ! Jim says he 's bound to break his neck . Poor fish ....

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: IndifferentlyOr his leg , or his back ; they all have to break something .Laughs .They are breakable toys .

lg.l: : I 'll be lonesome without them , Father ! The
Baron promised to make a ring for me to gallop over as much as I want .
He 's not lying ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: A ring ?Laughs .No , it 's not a lie . By the way , child , when speaking of Barons , you must say , “ he does not tell the truth , ” and not , “ he lies . ”

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: It 's just the same . It 's nice to be wealthy , Father ; you can do what you want , then .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: With enthusiasmEverything you want . Everything , my child . Ah ! Our fate is being decided to-day . Pray our clement God , Consuelo . The Baron is hanging on a thread .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: IndifferentlyYes ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Making the gesture with his fingersOn a very thin , silk thread . I am almost sure that he will make his proposal to-day .Laughs .Winter roses , and the web of a spider amongst the roses , in order that my dear little fly .... He is such a spider .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: IndifferentlyYes , a terrible spider . Father , ought n't I to let him kiss my hand yet ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: By no means . You do n't know yet , darling , what these men are .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Alfred never kisses .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Alfred ! Your Alfred is a cub , and he must n't dare . But with men of that sort , you must be extremely careful , my child . To-day he would kiss your little finger , to-morrow your hand , and after to-morrow you would be on his lap .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Foui ! Father , what are you talking about ? You should be ashamed !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: But I know ....

lg.l: Do n't you dare ! I do n't want to hear such dirty things . I shall give the
Baron such a slap ! A better one than HE — let him only try .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: With a deprecating gestureAll men are like that , child .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: It is n't true . Alfred is not . Ah ! But where is HE ? He said he 'd run , and he has n't come back .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: The buffet here is closed , and he has to get the sandwiches somewhere else . Consuelo , as your father , I want to warn you about HE . Do n't trust him . He knows something .Twirls his finger close to his forehead .His game is not fair .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: You say it about everybody . I know HE ; he is such a nice man , and he loves me so much .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Believe me , there is something in it .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Father , you make me sick with your advice . Ah ! HE , thank you .

div.stage: HE , breathing somewhat heavily , enters and gives her the sandwiches .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Eat , Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: A hot one .... But you were running , HE ? I am so grateful .Eats .HE , do you love me ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I do , my Queen . I am your court fool .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: EatingAnd when I leave , will you find another queen ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Making a ceremonious bowI shall follow after you , my incomparable one . I shall carry the train of your dress and wipe away my tears with it .Pretends to cry .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Idiot !Laughs .How sorry I am , HE , that those wonderful times have passed , when , in the court of the Counts Mancini , there were scores of motley fools who were given gold and kicks .... Now , Mancini is compelled to go to this dirty circus in order to see a good fool ; and still , whose fool is he ? Mine ? No . He belongs to everybody who pays a franc . We shall very soon be unable to breathe because of Democracy . Democracy , too , needs fools ! Think of it , HE ; what an unexampled impertinence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: We are the servants of those who pay . But how can we help it , Count ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: But is that not sad ? Imagine : we are in my castle . I , near the fireplace with my glass of wine , you , at my feet chatting your nonsense , jingling your little bells — diverting me . Sometimes you pinch me too with your jokes : it is allowed by the traditions and necessary for the circulation of the blood . After a while — I am sick of you , I want another one .... Then I give you a kick and .... Ah , HE , how wonderful it would be !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: It would be marvellous , Mancini !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes . Certainly ! You would be getting gold coins , those wonderfully little yellow things .... Well , when I become rich , I shall take you . That 's settled .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Take him , Father ....

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: And when the count , tired of my chattering , will give me a kick with his Highness 's foot , then I shall lie down at the little feet of my queen , and shall ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: LaughingWait for another kick ? I 'm finished . Father , give me your handkerchief , I want to wipe my hands . You have another one in your pocket . Oh , my goodness , I must work some more !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: UneasyBut do n't forget , my child !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , to-day I wo n't forget ! Go on !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Looking at his watchYes , it is time .... He asked me to come over when you were ready . You must change your dress before I come back .Laughing .Signori , miei complimenti .

div.stage: He goes out , playing with his cane . CONSUELO sits on the corner of the divan , and covers herself with her shawl .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Hello , HE ! Come and lie down at my feet , and tell me something cheerful .... You know , when you paint the laughter on your face , you are very good looking , but now , too , you are very , very nice . Come on , HE , why do n't you lie down ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Consuelo ! Are you going to marry the Baron ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: IndifferentlyIt seems so . The Baron is hanging by a thread ! HE , there is one little sandwich left . Eat it .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Thank you , my queen .Eats .And do you remember my prediction ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: What prediction ? How quickly you swallow ! Does it taste good ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Very good . That if you marry the Baron , you ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Oh , that 's what you 're talking about .... But you were making fun .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Nobody can tell , my Queen . Sometimes one makes fun , and suddenly it turns out to be true ; the stars never talk in vain . If sometimes it is difficult for a human being to open his mouth and to say a word , how difficult it must be for a star . Think of it .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: LaughingI should say . Such a mouth !Makes a tiny mouth .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: No , my dear little girl , were I in your place , I would think it over . And suppose suddenly you should die ? Do n't marry the Baron , Consuelo !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: ThinkingAnd what is — death ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I do not know , my Queen . Nobody knows . Like love ! Nobody knows . But your little hands will become cold , and your dear little eyes will be closed . You will be away from here . And the music will play without you , and without you the crazy Bezano will be galloping , and Tilly and Polly will be playing on their pipes without you : tilly-polly , tilly-polly ... tilly-tilly , polly-polly ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Please do n't , HE darling —— I am so sad , anyway ... tilly-tilly , polly-polly ...Silence . HE looks at CONSUELO .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You were crying , my little Consuelo ?

lg.l: Yes , a little . Alfred made me nervous . But tell me , is it my fault that
I can n't do anything to-day ? I tried to , but I could n't .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Ah , I do n't know . There is something here .Presses her hand against her heart .I do n't know . HE , I must be sick . What is sickness ? Does it hurt very much ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: It is not sickness . It is the charm of the far off stars , Consuelo . It is the voice of your fate , my little Queen .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Do n't talk nonsense , please . What should the stars care about me ? I am so small . Nonsense , HE ! Tell me rather another tale which you know : about the blue sea and those gods , you know ... who are so beautiful . Did they all die ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: They are all alive , but they hide themselves , my goddess .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: In the woods or mountains ? Can one come across them ? Ah , imagine HE ... I come across a god , and he suddenly takes a look at me ! I 'd run away .Laughs .This morning when I went without breakfast , I became so sad , so disgusted , and I thought : if a god should come , and give me something to eat ! And as I thought it , I suddenly heard , honestly it 's true , I heard : “ Consuelo , somebody 's calling you . ”Angrily .Do n't you dare laugh !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Am I laughing ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Honestly , it 's true . Ah , HE , but he did n't come . He only called me and disappeared , and how can you find him ? It hurt me so much , and hurts even now . Why did you remind me of my childhood ? I 'd forgotten it entirely . There was the sea ... and something ... many , manycloses her eyes , smiling .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Remember , Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No .Opening her eyesI forget everything about it .Looks around the room .HE , do you see what a poster they made for my benefit performance ? It 's Father 's idea . The Baron liked it .HE laughs . Silence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: SlowlyConsuelo , my Queen ! Do n't go to the Baron to-day .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Why ?After a silence .How fresh you are , HE .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Lowering his head , slowlyI do n't want it .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Getting upWhat ? You do n't want it ?

lg.l: I do not want you to marry the Baron
I ... I shall not allow it ... I beg you !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Whom , then , would you ask me to marry ? You , perhaps , you fool ?With a rancorous laughAre you crazy , my darling ? “ I shall not allow . ” HE ! HE will not allow me ! But it is unbearable ! What business is it of yours ?Walking up and down the room , looks over her shoulder at HE , with anger .Some fool clown , whom they can kick out of here any minute . You make me sick with your stupid tales . Or you like slaps so much . Fool , you could n't invent anything better than a slap !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Without lifting his headForgive me , my Queen .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: He is glad when they laugh at him . Some god ! No , I sha n't forgive . I know you .Makes same gesture as MANCINI .You have something there ! Laughs ... so nicely ... plays , plays , and then suddenly — hop ! Obey him ! No , darling , I am not that kind ! Carry my train , that is your business — fool !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I shall carry your train , my Queen . Forgive me . Give me back the image of my beautiful , piteous goddess .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Quieting downYou 're playing again ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I am .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: LaughingYou see !Sits down .Foolish HE .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I see everything , my Queen . I see how beautiful you are , and how low under your feet your poor court fool is lying . Somewhere in the abyss his little bells are ringing . He kneels before you and prays ; forgive and pity him , my divine one . He was too impudent ; he played so cheerfully that he went too far and lost his tiny little mind , the last bit of understanding he had saved up . Forgive me !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: All right . I forgive you .Laughs .And now will you allow me to marry the Baron ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Also laughingAnd nevertheless I will not allow it . But what does a queen care about the permission of her enamoured fool ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Get up . You are forgiven . And do you know why ? You think because of your words ? You are a cunning beast , HE ! No , because of the sandwiches . That 's why . You were so lovely , you panted so when you brought them . Poor darling HE . From to-morrow you may be at my feet again . And as soon as I whistle , “ tuwhooo ” ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I shall instantly lie down at thy feet , Consuelo . It is settled ! But all my little bells fell off to-day and ——

div.stage: Bezano appears , confused .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Alfred ! You came for me ?

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: Yes . Will you work some more , Consuelo ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Certainly . As much as you want . But I thought , Alfred , you were mad at me ? I sha n't dawdle any more .

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: No . You did n't dawdle . Do n't be offended , because I yelled so much . You know when one has to teach , and ——

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: My goodness , do you think I do n't understand ? You are too nice , unbearably nice , to like teaching such a fool as me . Do you think I do n't understand ? Come on !

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: Come on ! Hello , HE ! I have n't seen you yet to-day . How are you ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: How are you , Bezano ? Wait , wait a minute — stay here a minute , both of you — that way . Yes !

div.stage: CONSUELO and BEZANO stand side by side , the jockey scowling , CONSUELO laughing and flushing .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Like Adam and Eve ? How foolish you are ! Terribly .She runs away .I shall only change my slippers , Alfred .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Consuelo ! And how about Father and the Baron ? They will come soon , to take you with them .

lg.l: Let them come . They can wait . Not very important people .
lg.stage: Runs away . BEZANO hesitatingly follows her .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Stay here for a while , Bezano . Sit down .

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: What more do you want ? I have no time for your nonsense .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You can remain standing if you want . Bezano — you love her ?Silence .

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: I shall allow nobody to interfere with my affairs . You allow yourself too many liberties , HE . I do n't know you . You came from the street , and why should I trust you ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: But you know the Baron ? Listen . It is painful for me to pronounce these words : she loves you . Save her from the spider ! Or are you blind , and do n't see the web , which is woven in every dark corner . Get out of the vicious circle in which you are turning around , like a blind man . Take her away , steal her , do what you want ... kill her even , and take her to the heavens or to the devil ! But do n't give her to this man ! He is a defiler of love . And if you are timid , if you are afraid to lift your hand against her — kill the Baron ! Kill !

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: With a smileAnd who will kill the others , to come ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: She loves you .

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: Did she tell you that herself ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: What a petty , what a stupid , what a human pride ! But you are a little god ! A god , youth ! Why do n't you want to believe me ? Or does the street , from which I have come , bother you ? But look , look yourself . Look in my eyes , do such eyes lie ? Yes , my face is ugly , I make faces and grimaces , I am surrounded by laughter , but do n't you see the god behind all this , a god , like you ? Look , look at me !BEZANO bursts out laughing .What are you laughing at , youth ?

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: You look now as you did that evening in the ring . You remember ? When you were a great man , and they sent for you from the Academy , and suddenly — Hup ! HE Who Gets Slapped !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Laughing the same wayYes , yes , you are right , Bezano . There is a resemblance .With a strained expression , taking a pose“ It seems to me they sent for me from the Academy ! ”

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: DispleasedBut I do n't like this play . You can present your face for slaps if you want to , but do n't dare to expose mine .Turns to go .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Bezano !

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: Turning roundAnd never let me hear any more about Consuelo , and do n't dare to tell me again that I am a god ! It is disgusting .

div.stage: BEZANO goes out angrily , striking his boot with his whip . HE is alone . Wrathfully , with a tortured expression , he makes a step towards the jockey , then stops , with soundless laughter , his head thrown backwards . The BARON and MANCINI find him in this position , when they enter .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: LaughingWhat a cheerful chap you are , HE ! You laugh when you are alone .HE laughs aloud .Stop it fool ! How can you stand it ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Bowing low , with a large gestureHow do you do , Baron ? My humblest respects to you , Count . I beg your pardon , Count , but you found the clown at work . These are , so to speak , Baron , his every-day pleasures .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Lifting his eyebrowsTsss . But you are a clever man , HE . I shall ask Papa Briquet to give you a benefit performance . Shall I , HE ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Please do me the favour , Count .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Do n't overdo . Be more simple , HE .Laughs .But how many slaps will you get at your benefit performance , when even on weekdays they ring you like a gong ! A funny profession , is n't it , Baron ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Very strange . But where is the Countess ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , yes . I shall go for her at once . Dear child , she is so absorbed in her benefit performance and her work . They call this jumping work , Baron .

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: I can wait a little .Sits down , with his silk hat on his head .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: But why ? I shall hurry her up . I shall be back at once . And you , HE , be a nice host , and entertain our dear guest . You will not be bored in his company , Baron .

div.stage: He goes out . HE strides about the stage , smiling and glancing from time to time at the BARON . The latter sits with his legs spread apart and his chin on the top of his cane . The silk hat remains on his head . He is silent .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: In what way would you like me to entertain you , Baron ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: In no way ! I do n't like clowns .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Nor I Barons .

div.stage: Silence . HE puts on his derby hat , takes a chair with a large gesture , and puts it down heavily , in front of the BARON . HE sits astride it , imitating the pose of the BARON , and looks him in the eyes . Silence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Can you be silent very long ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Very long .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Taps on the floor with his footAnd can you wait very long ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Very long .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Until you get it ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Until I get it . And you ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I too .

div.stage: Both look at each other , silently , their heads close together . From the ring one hears the strains of the Tango .
CURTAIN

div.head: ACT IV

stage.stage: Music in the ring . More disorder in the room than usual . All kinds of actors ’ costumes hanging on pegs and lying in the corners . On the table a bouquet of fiery-red roses , put there by some careless hand . At the entrance , near the arch , three bareback riders are smoking and chattering ; they are all minor actors . All part their hair the same way ; two wear small moustaches ; the third one is clean-shaven with a face like a bull-dog .

sp.speaker: THE CLEAN-SHAVEN ONE
sp.p: Go on , Henry ! Ten thousand francs ! It 's too much even for the Baron .

sp.speaker: THE SECOND
sp.p: How much are roses now ?

lg.l: I do n't know . In winter they are certainly more expensive , but still
Henry talks nonsense . Ten thousand !

sp.speaker: THE SECOND
sp.p: The Baron has his own hothouse . They do n't cost him anything .

sp.speaker: HENRY
sp.p: Throwing away hit cigar , which has burned the tips of his fingersNo , Grab , you 're silly . There 's a whole car-load full ! One can smell the roses a mile away . They 're to cover the entire arena .

sp.speaker: THE SHAVEN
sp.p: Only the ring .

sp.speaker: HENRY
sp.p: It 's all the same . In order to cover the ring , you must have thousands and thousands of roses . You 'll see what it looks like , when they 've covered everything like a carpet . He ordered them to make it like a carpet ! Do you see , Grab ?

sp.speaker: THE SECOND
sp.p: What a Baron 's craze ! Is n't it time yet ?

sp.speaker: HENRY
sp.p: No , we have time enough . I rather like it : a fiery-red tango on a fiery-red cover of winter roses !

sp.speaker: THE SHAVEN
sp.p: Consuelo will be galloping on roses . And Bezano ?

sp.speaker: THE SECOND
sp.p: And Bezano on thorns .Smiles .

sp.speaker: THE SHAVEN
sp.p: That youngster has no self-respect . I 'd have refused .

sp.speaker: HENRY
sp.p: But it is his job . He 's got to do it .Laughs .Talk to him about self-respect . He 's as angry and proud as a little Satan .

sp.speaker: THE SECOND
sp.p: No , you may say what you like , it 's an excellent benefit performance . It 's a joy to look at the crowd . They 're so excited .

sp.speaker: HENRY
sp.p: Tss !All throw away their cigars and cigarettes , like school boys who are caught , and make way for ZINIDA , who enters with HE .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: What are you doing here , gentlemen ? Your place is at the entrance .

lg.l: : We are here just for a minute , Madame
Zinida . We are going . What a successful evening ! And what a glory for
Papa Briquet !

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Yes . Go , and please do n't leave your places .They go . ZINIDA pulls a drawer out of the desk , and puts in some papers . She is in her lion tamer 's costume .HE , what were you doing near my lions ? You frightened me .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Why , Duchess , I merely wanted to hear what the beasts were saying about the benefit performance . They are pacing in their cages , and growling .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: The music makes them nervous . Sit down , HE . An excellent evening , and I am so glad that Consuelo is leaving us . Have you heard about the Baron 's roses .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Everybody is talking about them . The Hymeneal roses !

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Here are some , too .Pushes away the bouquet .You find them everywhere . Yes , I am glad . She is superfluous here , and disturbs our work . It is a misfortune for a cast to have in it such a beautiful and such an ... accessible girl .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: But it is an honest marriage , Duchess , is it not ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: I do n't care what it is .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Spiders , too need an improvement in their breed ! Ca n't you imagine , Zinida , what charming little spiders this couple will create ! They will have the face of their mother , Consuelo , and the stomach of their father , the Baron , and thus could be an ornament for any circus-ring .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: You are malicious to-day , HE . You are morose .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I laugh .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: You do , but without joy . Why are you without make-up ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I am in the third act . I have time . And how does Bezano feel about this evening . Is he glad ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: I did n't talk to Bezano . You know what I think , my friend ? You , too , are superfluous here .Silence .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: How do you want me to take that , Zinida ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Just as I said . In fact , Consuelo sold herself for nothing . What is the Baron worth , with his poor millions ? People say that you are clever , too clever perhaps ; tell me then , for how much could one buy me ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Looking as if he were pricing herOnly for a crown .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: A baron 's crown ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: No , a royal one .

lg.l: You are far from being stupid . And you guessed that Consuelo is not
Mancini 's daughter ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: StartledWhat ! And she knows it ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Hardly . Why should she know it ? Yes , she is a girl from Corsica whose parents are unknown . He preferred to use her for business rather than .... But according to the law , she is his daughter , Countess Veronica Mancini .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: It is nice , to have everything done according to law , is n't it , Zinida ? But it is curious there is more blue blood in her than in this Mancini . One would say that it was she who found him on the street , and made him a count and her father . Count Mancini !Laughs .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Yes , you are gloomy , HE . I changed my mind , you 'd better stay .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Will I not be superfluous ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: When she is gone , you will not . Oh ! You do n't know yet , how nice it is to be with us . What a rest for the body and mind . I understand you . I am clever , too . Like you , I brought with me from out there my inclination for chains , and for a long time I chained myself to whatever I could , in order to feel firm .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Bezano ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Bezano and others ; there were many , there will be many more . My red lion , with whom I am desperately in love , is still more terrible than Bezano . But it is all nonsense ; old habits , which we are sorry to let go , like old servants who steal things . Leave Consuelo alone . She has her own way .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Automobiles and diamonds ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: When did you see a beauty clad in simple cotton ? If this one does not buy her , another will . They buy off everything that is beautiful . Yes , I know . For the first ten years she will be a sad beauty , who will attract the eyes of the poor man on the side-walk : afterward she will begin to paint a little around her eyes and smile , and then will take ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Her chauffeur or butler as a lover ? You 're not guessing badly , Zinida !

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Am I not right ? I do n't want to intrude on your confidence , but to-day I am sorry for you , HE . What can you do against Fate ? Do n't be offended , my friend , by the words of a woman . I like you ; you are not beautiful , nor young , nor rich , and your place is ——

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: On the side-walk , from which one looks at the beauties .Laughs .And if I do n't want to ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: What does it matter , your “ want ” or “ do n't want ” ? I am sorry for you , my poor friend , but if you are a strong man , and I think you are , then there is only one way for you . To forget .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You think that that 's being strong ? And you are saying this , you , Queen Zinida , who want to awaken the feeling of love , even in the heart of a lion ? For one second of an illusory possession , you are ready to pay with your life , and still you advise me to forget ! Give me your strong hand , my beautiful lady ; see how much strength there is in this pressure , and do n't pity me .

div.stage: Enter BRIQUET and MANCINI . The latter it reserved , and self-consciously imposing . He has a new suit , but the same cane , and the same noiseless smile of a satyr .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: WhisperingWill you stay ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes . I sha n't go away .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: How are you , my dear ? But you are dazzling , my dear ! I swear you are marvellous ! Your lion would be an ass , if he did not kiss your hand , as I do ....Kisses her hand .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: May I congratulate you , Count ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , merci .To HEHow are you , my dear ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Good evening , Count !

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Zinida , the Count wants to pay immediately for the breach of contract with Consuelo ... the Countess 's contract . Do n't you remember , Mother , how much it is ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: I 'll look it up , Papa .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , please . Consuelo will not return here any more . We leave to-morrow .

div.stage: ZINIDA and BRIQUET search among the papers . HE takes MANCINI roughly by the elbow , and draws him aside .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: In a low voiceHow are your girls , Mancini ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: What girls ? What is this , stupidity or blackmail ? Look out , sir , be careful , the policeman is not far .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You are much too severe , Mancini . I assumed , that since we are tete-a-tete ....

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: But tell me , what kind of tete-a-tete is possible , between a clown and me ?Laughs .You are stupid , HE . You should say what you want , and not ask questions !

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Three thousand francs , Count .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Is that all ? For Consuelo ? All right . I 'll tell the Baron .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: You took ——

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Do n't , Mother , do n't .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Count , you drew in advance , I have it written down , eighty francs and twenty centimes . Will you pay this money , too ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Certainly , certainly . You will get three thousand and one hundred .LaughingTwenty centimes ! I never thought I could be so accurate .SeriouslyYes , my friends . My daughter Consuelo — the Countess — and the Baron , expressed their desire to bid farewell to the whole cast .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: The Baron , too ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , Auguste , too . They want to do it during the intermission . Therefore , I ask you to gather here ... the more decent ones ... but please do n't make it too crowded ! HE , will you , sir , be kind enough to run into the buffet and tell them to bring right away a basket of champagne , bottles and glasses — you understand ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , Count .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Wait a minute , what 's the hurry — what is this , a new costume ? You are all burning like the devils in hell !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You do me too much honour , Count , I am not a devil . I am merely a poor sinner who the devils are frying a little .He goes out , bowing like a clown .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: A gifted chap , but too cunning .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: It 's the Tango colour , in honour of your daughter , Count . He needs it for a new stunt , which he does n't want to tell in advance . Do n't you want to sit down , Count ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Auguste is waiting for me , but ... it 's all right .Takes a seat .Nevertheless I am sorry to leave you , my friend . High society , certainly , prerogatives of the title , castles of exalted noblemen , but where could I find such freedom , and ... such simplicity .... And besides , these announcements , these burning posters , which take your breath in the morning , they had something which summoned , which encouraged .... There , my friends , I shall become old .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: But pleasures of a higher kind , Count . Why are you silent , Zinida ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: I 'm listening .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: By the way , my dear , how do you like my suit ? You have wonderful taste .Spreads out his lace tie and lace cuffs .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: I like it . You look like a nobleman of the courts of long ago .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes ? But do n't you think it is too conspicuous ? Who wears lace and satin now ? This dirty democracy will soon make us dress ourselves in sack cloth .With a sighAuguste told me that this jabot was out of place .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: The Baron is too severe .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Yes , but it seems to me he is right . I am a little infected with your fancy .HE returns . Two waiters follow him , carrying a basket of champagne and glasses . They prepare everything on the table .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Ah ! merci , HE . But , please , none of this bourgeoise exploding of corks ; be slower and more modest . Send the bill to Baron Regnard . Then , we will be here , Briquet . I must go .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Looks at her watchYes , the act is going to end soon .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Heavens !Disappears in a hurry .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: The devil take him !

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Pointing to the waiterNot so loud , Louis !

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: No ! The devil take him ! And why could n't you help me , Mother ? You left me alone to talk to him . High Society ! High pleasures ! Swindler !HE and ZINIDA laugh . The waiters smile .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: To the waitersWhat are you laughing about ? You can go . We will help ourselves . Whiskey and soda , Jean !In a low and angry voiceChampagne !Enter JACKSON , in his clown 's costume .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: A whiskey and soda for me , too ! At least I hear some laughter here . Those idiots have simply forgotten how to laugh . My sun was rising and setting and crawling all over the ring —— and not a smile ! Look at my bottom , shines like a mirror !Turns around quickly .Beg your pardon , Zinida . And you do n't look badly to-night , HE . Look out for your cheeks . I hate beauties .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: A benefit performance crowd !

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Looking in a hand mirror , correcting his make-upIn the orchestra there are some Barons and Egyptian mummies . I got a belly-ache from fright . I am an honest clown . I can n't stand it when they look at me as if I had stolen a handkerchief . HE , please give them a good many slaps to-night .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Be quiet , Jim . I shall avenge you .HE goes out .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: And how is Bezano ?

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: GrumblingBezano ! A crazy success . But he is crazy , he will break his neck to-morrow . Why does he run such a risk ? Or perhaps he has wings , like a god ? Devil take it . It 's disgusting to look at him . It 's not work any more .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: You are right , Jim ! It is not work any more . To your health , old comrade , Jackson .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: To yours , Louis .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: It is not work any more , since these Barons came here ! Do you hear ? They are laughing . But I am indignant , I am indignant , Jim ! What do they want here , these Barons ? Let them steal hens in other hen roosts , and leave us in peace . Ah ! Had I been Secretary of the Interior , I should have made an iron fence between us and those people .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: I am very sorry myself for our dear little Consuelo . I do n't know why , but it seems to me that we all look to-day more like swindlers than honest artists . Do n't you think so , Zinida ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Everybody does what he wants . It 's Consuelo 's business and her father 's .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: No , Mother , that 's not true ! Not everybody does what he wants , but it turns out this way ... devil knows why .Enter ANGELICA and THOMAS , an athlete .

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: Is this where we 're going to have champagne ?

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: And you 're glad already ?

sp.speaker: THOMAS
sp.p: There it is ! Oh , oh , what a lot !

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: The Count told me to come here . I met him .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: AngrilyAll right , if he said so , but there is no reason to enjoy it . Look out , Angelica , you will have a bad end . I see you through and through . How does she work , Thomas ?

sp.speaker: THOMAS
sp.p: Very well .

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: In a low voiceHow angry Papa Briquet is to-night .

div.stage: Enter HE , TILLY , POLLY , and other actors , all in their costumes .

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: Do you really want champagne ?

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: I do n't want it at all . Do you , Tilly ?

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: And I do n't want it . HE , did you see how the Count walks ?Walks , imitating MANCINI . Laughter .

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: Let me be the Baron . Take my arm . Look out , ass , you stepped on my beloved family tree !

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: It 'll soon be finished . Consuelo is galloping now . It is her waltz . What a success she is having !

div.stage: All listen to the waltz . TILLY and POLLY are singing it softly .

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: She is so beautiful ! Are those her flowers ?

div.stage: They listen . Suddenly , a crash as if a broken wall were tumbling down : applause , shouting , screaming ; much motion on the stage . The actors are pouring champagne . New ones come in , talking and laughing . When they notice the director and the champagne , they become quiet and modest .

sp.speaker: VOICES
sp.p: They 're coming ! What a success ! I should say , since all the orchestra seats .... And what will it be when they see the Tango ? Do n't be envious , Alphonse .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Silence ! Not so much noise , please ! Zinida , look here , do n't be so quiet ! High society !

div.stage: Enter CONSUELO , on the arm of the BARON who is stiff and erect . She is happy . MANCINI , serious and happy . Behind them , riders , actors , actresses . The BARON has in his button-hole a fiery-red rose . All applaud and cry : “ Bravo , bravo ! ”

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Friends ... my dears ... Father , I can n't ...Throws herself into MANCINI 'S arms , and hides her face on his shoulders . MANCINI looks with a smile over her head at the BARON . BARON smiles slightly , but remains earnest and motionless . A new burst of applause .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Enough , children ! Enough !

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Calm yourself , calm yourself , my child . How they all love you !Taking a step forwardLadies and gentlemen , Baron Regnard did me the honour yesterday , to ask for the hand of my daughter , the Countess Veronica , whom you knew under the name of Consuelo . Please take your glasses .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , I am still Consuelo , to-night , and I shall always be Consuelo ! Zinida , dear !Falls on the neck of ZINIDA . Fresh applause .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Stop it ! Silence ! Take your glasses . What are you standing here for ? If you came , then take the glasses .

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: TremblingThey are frightened . You take yours first , Papa , and we will follow .

div.stage: They take the glasses . CONSUELO is near the BARON , holding the sleeve of his dress coat with her left hand . In her right hand , she has a glass of champagne , which spills over .

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: You are spilling your wine , Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Ah ! It is nothing ! I am frightened , too . Are you , Father ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Silly child .An awkward silence .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: With a step forwardCountess ! As the director of the circus , who was happy enough ... to witness ... many times ... your successes ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I do not like this , Papa Briquet ! I am Consuelo . What do you want to do with me ? I shall cry . I do n't want this “ Countess . ” Give me a kiss , Briquet !

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Ah , Consuelo ! Books have killed you .

div.stage: Kisses her with tears . Laughter , applause . The clowns cluck like hens , bark , and express their emotions in many other ways . The motley crowd of clowns , which is ready for the pantomime , becomes more and more lively . The BARON is motionless , there is a wide space around him ; the people touch glasses with him in a hurry , and go off to one side . With CONSUELO they clink willingly and cheerfully . She kisses the women .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Silence ! Consuelo , from to-day on , I extinguish my sun . Let the dark night come after you leave us . You were a nice comrade and worker , we all loved you and will love the traces of your little feet on the sand . Nothing remains to us !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: You are so good , so good , Jim . So good that there is no one better . And your sun is better than all the other suns . I laughed so much at it . Alfred , dear , why do n't you come ? I was looking for you .

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: My congratulations , Countess .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Alfred , I am Consuelo !

sp.speaker: BEZANO
sp.p: When you are on horseback ; but here — I congratulate you , Countess .He passes , only slightly touching CONSUELO 'S glass . CONSUELO still holds it . MANCINI looks at the BARON with a smile . The latter is motionless .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Nonsense , Bezano . You are making Consuelo unhappy . She is a good comrade .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , it 's all right .

sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.p: You 'll dance the Tango with her to-night , so how is she a countess ?

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: May I clink glasses with you , Consuelo ? You know Polly has died of grief already , and I am going to die . I have such a weak stomach .

div.stage: Laughter ; BARON shows slight displeasure . General motion .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Enough , enough ! The intermission is over .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Already ? It 's so nice here .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: I shall prolong it . They can wait . Tell them , Thomas .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Auguste , the musicians of the orchestra , too , ask permission to congratulate you and Consuelo . Do you ...?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Certainly , certainly .

div.stage: Enter crowd of musicians . The conductor , an old Italian , lifts his glass solemnly and without looking at the BARON .

lg.l: Consuelo ! They call you Countess here , but for me you were and are
Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Certainly !

sp.speaker: THE CONDUCTOR
sp.p: Consuelo ! My violins and bassoons , my trumpets and drums , all are drinking your health . Be happy , dear child , as you were happy here . And we shall conserve for ever in our hearts the fair memory of our light-winged fairy , who guided our bows so long . I have finished ! Give my love to our beautiful Italy , Consuelo .

div.stage: Applause , compliments . The musicians one after another clink glasses and go out into the corridor . CONSUELO is almost crying .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Do n't be so sensitive , my child , it is indecent . Had I known that you would respond this way to this comedy — Auguste , look how touched this little heart is !

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Calm yourself , Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: It is all right . Ah , Father , listen !

div.stage: The musicians are playing the Tango in the corridor . Exclamations .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: You see . It is for you .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: They are so nice . My Tango ! I want to dance . Who is going to dance with me ?Looks around , seeking BEZANO , who turns away sadly .Who , then ?

sp.speaker: VOICES
sp.p: Baron ! Let the Baron dance ! Baron !

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: All right .Takes CONSUELO 'S arm , and stands in the centre of a circle which is formed .I do not know how to dance the Tango , but I shall hold tight . Dance , Consuelo .He stands with legs spread , heavily and awkwardly , like an iron-moulded man , holding CONSUELO 'S arm firmly and seriously .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: ApplaudingBravo ! Bravo !CONSUELO makes a few restless movements , and pulls her arm away .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , I can n't this way . How stupid ! Let me go !She goes to ZINIDA and embraces her , as if hiding herself . The music still plays . The BARON goes off quietly to the side . There is an unfriendly silence among the cast . They shrug their shoulders .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: AloneBravo ! Bravo ! It is charming , it is exquisite !

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Not entirely , Count .

div.stage: TILLY and POLLY imitate the BARON and CONSUELO without moving from their places .

sp.speaker: TILLY
sp.p: ShriekingLet me go !

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: No , I 'll not . Dance !

div.stage: The music stops abruptly . General , too loud laughter ; the clowns bark and roar . Papa BRIQUET gesticulates , in order to re-establish silence . The BARON is apparently as indifferent as before .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Really these vagabonds are becoming too impertinent .Shrugging his shouldersIt smells of the stable . You cannot help it , Auguste !

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Do n't be upset , Count .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Holding his glass , approaches the BARONBaron . Will you permit me to make a toast ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Make it .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: To your dance !Slight laughter in the crowd .

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: I do n't dance !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Then another one , Baron . Let us drink to those who know how to wait longer , until they get it .

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: I do not accept any toasts which I do not understand . Say it more simply .

div.stage: Voice of a woman : “ Bravo , HE ! ” Slight laughter .

sp.speaker: MANCINI says something hastily to BRIQUET ; the latter spreads
sp.p: his arms in gesture of helplessness . JACKSON takes HE by the arm . ]

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Beat it , HE ! The Baron does n't like jokes .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: But I want to drink with the Baron . What can be simpler ? Simpler ? Baron , let us drink to the very small distance which will always remain ‘ twixt the cup and the lip !Spills his wine , and laughs .

div.stage: The BARON turns his back on him , indifferently . The music plays in the ring . The bell rings .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: RelievedThere ! To the ring , ladies and gentlemen , to the ring , to the ring !

div.stage: The actresses run out . The crowd becomes smaller ; laughter and voices .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Much excited , whispers to the BARON“ Auguste , Auguste —— ”

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: To ZINIDAThank heaven they 're beginning . Ah , Mother , I asked you ... but you want a scandal by all means , and you always ——

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Let me alone , Louis .

div.stage: HE approaches Consuelo , who is alone .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: HE , deary , how are you ? I thought you did n't want even to come near me .In a low voiceDid you notice Bezano ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I was waiting for my turn , Queen . It was so difficult to get through the crowd to approach you .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Through the crowd ?With a sad smileI am quite alone . What do you want , Father ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Child ! Auguste ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Pulling away her handLet me alone ! I 'll soon be —— Come here , HE . What did you say to him ? They all laughed . I could n't understand . What ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I joked , Consuelo .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Please do n't , HE , do n't make him angry ; he is so terrible . Did you see how he pressed my arm ? I wanted to scream .With tears in her eyesHe hurt me !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: It 's not too late yet . Refuse him .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: It is too late , HE . Do n't talk about it .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Do you want it ? I will take you away from here .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Where to ?Laughs .Ah , my dear little silly boy , where could you take me to . All right , be quiet . How pale you are ! You too , love me ? Do n't HE , please do n't ! Why do they all love me ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You are so beautiful !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: No , no . It 's not true . They must not love me . I was still a little cheerful , but when they began to speak ... so nicely ... and about Italy ... and to bid farewell , as if I were dying , I thought I should begin to cry . Do n't talk , do n't talk , but drink to ... my happiness .With a sad smileTo my happiness , HE . What are you doing ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I am throwing away the glass from which you drank with the others . I shall give you another one . Wait a minute .Goes to pour champagne . CONSUELO walks about thoughtfully . Almost all are gone . Only the principal figures are left .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Coming to herBut it is really becoming indecent , Veronica . Auguste is so nice , he is waiting for you , and you talk here with this clown . Some stupid secrets . They 're looking at you — it is becoming noticeable . It is high time , Veronica , to get rid of these habits .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: LoudlyLet me alone , Father ! I want to do so , and will do so . They are all my friends . Do you hear ? Let me alone !

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Do n't , Count . Please , Consuelo , talk to whomever you please and as much as you want . Would you like a cigar , Count ? Dear Briquet , please order them to prolong the intermission a little more .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: With pleasure , Baron . The orchestra crowd can be a little angry .Goes , and returns shortly . HE gives a glass to CONSUELO .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Here is your glass . To your happiness , to your freedom , Consuelo !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: And where is yours ? We must touch our glasses .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: You leave half .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Must I drink so much ? HE , deary , I shall become drunk . I still have to ride .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: No , you will not be drunk . Dear little girl , did you forget that I am your magician ? Be quiet and drink . I charmed the wine . My witchery is in it . Drink , goddess .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: LingeringlyWhat kind eyes you have . But why are you so pale ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Because I love you . Look at my kind eyes and drink ; give yourself up to my charms , goddess ! You shall fall asleep , and wake again , as before . Do you remember ? And you shall see your country , your sky ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Bringing the glass to her lipsI shall see all this ; is that true ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Growing palerYes ! Awake , goddess , and remember the time when , covered with snow-white sea-foam , thou didst emerge from the sky blue waters . Remember heaven , and the low eastern wind , and the whisper of the foam at thy marble feet ....

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: DrinkingThere ! Look ! Just a half ! Take it . But what is the matter with you ? Are you laughing or crying ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: I am laughing and crying .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Pushing HE away , slightlyEnough , Countess , my patience is exhausted . If Auguste is good enough to allow it , then I , your Father — Your arm , Countess ! Will you step aside , sir ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I am tired .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: You are not too tired to chatter and drink wine with a clown , and when your duty calls you — Briquet ! Tell them to ring the bell . It is time .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I am tired , Father .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Count , it is cruel . Do n't you see how pale she has become ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: What is the matter with you , dear little Consuelo ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Nothing .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: She simply needs a rest , Baron . She has n't sat down yet ... and so much excitement .... Sit down here , dear child . Cover yourself and rest a little . Men are so cruel !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I still have to work .Closing her eyes .And the roses , are they ready ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Ready , dear , ready . You will have such an extraordinary carpet . You will gallop as if on air . Rest .

sp.speaker: POLLY
sp.p: Do you want some moosic ? We will play you a song ; do you want it ?

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Smiling , eyes closedYes , I do .

div.stage: The clowns play a soft and naive song : tilly-polly , tilly-polly . General silence . HE sits in the corner with his face turned away . JACKSON watches him out of the corner of his eye , and drinks wine , lazily . The BARON , in his usual pose , wide and heavily spread legs , looks at the pale face of CONSUELO , with his bulging motionless eyes .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: With a sudden cryAh ! Pain !

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: What is it , Consuelo ?

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: My child ! Are you sick ! Calm yourself .

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Growing paleWait a moment .... She was too much excited .... Consuelo !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Gets up , looking before her with wide-open eyes , as if she were listening to something within herselfAh ! I feel pain . Here at the heart . Father , what is it ? I am afraid . What is it ? My feet too ... I can n't stand ....Falls on divan , her eyes wide open .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Running aboutBring a doctor ! Heavens , it is terrible ! Auguste , Baron .... It never happened to her . It is nerves , nerves .... Calm yourself , calm , child ——

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Bring a doctor !Somebody runs for a doctor .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: In a voice full of fearHE , what is the matter with you ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: It is death , Consuelo , my little Queen . I killed you . You are dying .

div.stage: He cries , loudly and bitterly . CONSUELO with a scream , closes her eyes , and becomes silent and quiet . All are in terrible agitation . The BARON is motionless , and sees only CONSUELO .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: FuriousYou are lying , rascal ! Damned clown ! What did you give her ? You poisoned her ! Murderer ! Bring a doctor !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: A doctor will not help . You are dying , my little Queen . Consuelo ! Consuelo !

div.stage: BEZANO rushes in , cries : “ BRIQUET ! ” becomes silent and looks with horror at CONSUELO . Somebody else comes in . BRIQUET is making gestures for someone to close the door .

lg.stage: In a dull and distant voice
lg.l: : You are joking , HE ? Do n't frighten me .
I am so frightened . Is that death ? I do n't want it . Ah , HE , my darling
HE , tell me that you are joking , I am afraid , my dear , golden HE !

div.stage: HE pushes away the BARON , with a commanding gesture , and stands in his place near CONSUELO . The BARON stands as before , seeing only CONSUELO .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , I am joking . Do n't you hear how I laugh , Consuelo ? They all laugh at you here , my silly child . Do n't laugh , Jim . She is tired , and wants to sleep . How can you laugh , Jim ! Sleep my dear , sleep my heart , sleep my love .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Yes , I have no more pain . Why did you joke that way , and frighten me ? Now I laugh at myself . You told me , did n't you , that I ... should ... live ... eternally ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Yes , Consuelo ! You shall live eternally . Sleep . Be calm .Lifts up his arms , as if straining with all his forces to lift her soul higher .How easy it is now ! How much light , how many lights are burning about you .... The light is blinding you .

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: Yes , light .... Is that the ring ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: No , it is the sea and the sun ... what a sun ! Do n't you feel that you are the foam , white sea-foam , and you are flying to the sun ? You feel light , you have no body , you are flying higher , my love !

sp.speaker: CONSUELO
sp.p: I am flying . I am the sea-foam , and this is the sun , it shines ... so strong .... I feel well .

div.stage: She dies . Silence . HE stays a moment with lifted arms , then takes a long look , lets his arms fall , and shakingly goes off to one side . He stands still for a moment , then sits down , drops hit head on his hands , and struggles lonesomely with the torpidity of coming death .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: SlowlyShe has fallen asleep , Mother ?

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Dropping the dead handI am afraid not .... Step aside , Louis . Baron , it is better for you to step aside . Baron ! Do you hear me ?Weeps .She is dead , Louis .

div.stage: The clowns and BRIQUET are crying . MANCINI is overwhelmed . The BARON and HE are motionless , each in his place .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Drawing out a large prismatic clown 's handkerchief to wipe away his tearsFaded , like a flower . Sleep , little Consuelo ! The only thing that remains of you is the trace of your little feet on the sand .Cries .Ah , what did you do , what did you do , HE !... It would have been better if you had never come to us .There it music in the ring .

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: GesticulatingThe music ! Stop the music ! They are crazy there . What a misfortune !

div.stage: Someone runs off . ZINIDA approaches the crying BEZANO and strokes his bowed , pomaded head . When he notices her , he catches her hand and presses it to his eyes . The BARON takes the rose from his button-hole , tears off the petals , and drops it , grinding it with his foot . A few pale faces peer through the door , the same masquerade crowd .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Over the head of BEZANOLouis , we must call the police .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: Awakening from his stupor , screamsThe police ! Call the police ! It 's a murder ! I am Count Mancini , I am Count Mancini ! They will cut off your head , murderer , damned clown , thief ! I myself will kill you , rascal ! Ah , you !HE lifts his heavy head with difficulty .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: They will cut off my head ? And what more .... Your Excellency ?

sp.speaker: BARON
sp.p: Sir ! Listen , sir ! I am going for the police . Stop it , sir .He suddenly takes a step forward , and looking HE in the eyes , speaks in a hoarse voice , with a cough , holding one hand at his throat .I am the witness . I saw . I am a witness . I saw how he put poison ... I ——

div.stage: He leaves the room , suddenly , with the same straight , heavy steps . All move away from him , frightened . HE drops his head again . From time to time a tremor shakes his body .

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Clasping his handsThen it is all true ? Poisoned ! What a vile man you are , HE . Is this the way to play ? Now wait for the last slap of the executioner !Makes the gesture around his neck , of the guillotine . Tilly and Polly repeat the gesture .

sp.speaker: ZINIDA
sp.p: Leave his soul alone , Jim . He was a man , and he loved . Happy Consuelo !

div.stage: A shot is heard in the corridor . THOMAS , frightened , runs in and points to his head .

sp.speaker: THOMAS
sp.p: Baron ... Baron ... his head .... He shot himself ?...

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Throwing his arms upGod ! What is it ? The Baron ? What a calamity for our circus .

sp.speaker: MANCINI
sp.p: The Baron ? The Baron ? No . What are you standing here for ? Ah !

sp.speaker: BRIQUET
sp.p: Calm down , Count . Who would have believed it ? Such a respectable ... gentleman !

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Lifting his head with difficulty ; he sees only dimly with his dulled eyesWhat more ? What happened ?

sp.speaker: THOMAS
sp.p: The Baron shot himself . Honestly . Straight here ! He 's lying out yonder .

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Thinking it overBaron ?Laughs .Then the Baron burst ?

sp.speaker: JACKSON
sp.p: Stop it ! It 's shameless . A man died and you .... What 's the matter with you , HE ?

sp.speaker: HE
sp.p: Stands up , lifted to his feet by the last gleam of consciousness and life , speaks strongly and indignantlyYou loved her so much , Baron ? So much ? My Consuelo ? And you want to be ahead of me even there ? No ! I am coming . We shall prove then whose she is to be for ever ....

div.stage: He catches at his throat , falls on his back . People run to him . General agitation .
CURTAIN
